thread.title: Twitter responds to Trump telling staff to 'dress like women' with hashtag
thread.title_full: Twitter responds to Trump telling staff to 'dress like women' with hashtag

author: Mary Ward
title: Twitter responds to Trump telling staff to 'dress like women' with hashtag
text:
Twitter responds to Trump telling staff to 'dress like women' with hashtag Mary Ward twitter TWEET More 
According to a White House source who spoke to Axios earlier this week , newly-elected US President Donald Trump likes the women who work for him to "dress like women". 
And, of course, Twitter users across the world absolutely agree. SHARE Brie Larson shows Donald Trump how she "dresses like a woman". Photo: Twitter/brielarson 
Because dressing like a woman involves wearing... well, absolutely anything. 
Using the hashtag "#dresslikeawoman" women shared photographs of themselves dressing "like a woman". 
As this tweet demonstrates, the process is very simple: Step 1: Be a woman Step 2: Put on literally any article of clothing congrats, you are now dressed like a woman â€” Jenna (@jrmr126) February 3, 2017 
Women from all walks of life shared took pictures as they headed off to work (or, you know, dug out their wedding album). I'm Rhys and I study carbon fibre composites and run + curate @womenofsci campaign. I'm a #actuallivingscientist ps I also #DressLikeAWoman pic.twitter.com/dvpdzbMzOW â€” Marie Nina (@MarieNinaAune) February 3, 2017 #DressLikeAWoman Marry a woman while ur both dressed like women! pic.twitter.com/YxucRXtfQH â€” Erica Joy (@Tenderbutch9) February 3, 2017 Hey @POTUS This is how I #dresslikeawoman How about you start to #actlikeapresident pic.twitter.com/PQbLhODVx8 â€” Lisa A. Weir (@lisaweir77) February 3, 2017 Put on that flight suit and #DressLikeAWoman ðŸš€ pic.twitter.com/s2D3uOL0ri â€” Emily Calandrelli (@TheSpaceGal) February 3, 2017 Celebrities joined in on the fun, with Room actress Brie Larson and One Tree Hill 's Sophia Bush sharing pictures of themselves at work. Director/producer/writer/academy award winner in her office with a view. I'll dress how I damn well please thankyouverymuch #dresslikeawoman pic.twitter.com/G7fJPuLvnE â€” Brie Larson (@brielarson) February 4, 2017 A photo posted by Sophia Bush (@sophiabush) on Feb 3, 2017 at 1:55pm PST 
According to the Axios source, Trump's staffers feel pressure to wear dresses to "impress Trump". 
If only they knew they could fulfil his brief by wearing absolutely any item of clothing in their wardrobe! Advertisement
